Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus welcome Kosovo to Larnaca in League C Group 2 of the UEFA Nations League on Monday on the back of an impressive win on matchday one.
Cyprus ended a five-year wait for an away win on Friday and have been strong at home in previous editions of the Nations League.
Kosovo have struggled in recent years performing when being favorites, especially in Euro 2024 qualifying, and have had difficulty scoring in their last five matches.

Cyprus's strong home performance in the Nations League and a recent win could be a catalyst for better results, while Kosovo's manager Franco Foda is under pressure after a poor performance in their first competitive fixture.
Cyprus and Kosovo have had a combined head-to-head score of 7-1 in their previous two meetings in the Nations League, with Kosovo dominating both occasions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is held at AEK Arena - George Karapatakis.
Kosovo's Albion Rrahmani may start in attack after a poor performance from the team in their previous match.
